display: This workspace is a public project to write a novel with input from J Wynia's social media community via LLM agent. It does not yet have a context network initialized and needs one. Details on that pattern are in @inbox/context-network-guide.md. The README has a tiny blurb in it about how this project came to be. For now, I just want to initialize a context network with information already provided. We'll expand from there.
The @CLAUDE.md file should also contain proper instructions for bootstrapping context as detailed in @inbox/context-network-prompt.md

This project is run via the github project at https://github.com/jwynia/the-kepler-testimonies. We should work in branches and put in PRs for work we do on the novel. Decisions that the human group should make go up as polls on github. Work items we identify that need to be worked on later and not in the immediate session should be logged as github issues. The discussions should be used for announcements, etc. The gh cli is logged in and should be used for github activity. All of this should be documented into the context network as part of our working process rules.
yes
merged
/clear

All that was presented for choice by collaborators so far was the title and the single line description. We need to brainstorm some next step options for people to vote on to start establishing what this novel will be about and start working toward an outline.

I personally dislike sci-fi with telekinesis/mindreading/shared consciousness, as it reads as magic/fantasy to me more than sci-fi. That's sort of my own cliche framework addition, but we should run the cliche skill on those options
yes
Update with that replacement
Let's adjust embassy and the other moderate cliche risks first via the cliche skill
yes
For all of these voting issues, we should always offer up 'none of these' and a suggestion of a better approach.
yes
OK. I think we're ready to put in a PR (including all .claude file changes that we're sharing for full transparency on project activity) and create the gh discussion for vote.
Folks are saying they can't vote on the polls with emojis
Commit, PR and push those changes.
Those changes didn't actually result in a clickable poll. Use the research skill to look up the right way to do polls.
I made them manually, but we should augment that PR with updated info
Also review PR https://github.com/jwynia/the-kepler-testimonies/pull/5
